snippet: After a harsh winter that kept retail sales low, consumers spent more in March than they had in 18 months — a signal that growth in the quarter could be strong.
abstract: Commerce Department reports that retail sales rose 1.1 percent in March, biggest gain since September 2012; signal indicates growth in second quarter could be strong and offers sign that economy is bouncing back from weather-induced slowdown; separate report shows that business inventories rose 0.4 percent in February, little less than expected.
lead_paragraph: After a harsh winter that kept retail sales low, consumers spent more in March than they had in 18 months — a signal that growth in the quarter could be strong.

headline.main: March Retail Sales Surged, Bolstering Hopes
headline.print_headline: March Retail Sales Surged, Bolstering Hopes
